author.name: [bitcoin-dev] bitcoin.org missing bitcoin core version 22.0 Owen Gunden

entry.title: bitcoin.org missing bitcoin core version 22.0
entry.summary:
The confusion surrounding the download of Bitcoin Core highlights a significant issue in the accessibility and presentation of cryptocurrency resources. Currently, individuals searching for "download bitcoin core" are directed to bitcoin.org as the top result. However, this site does not offer the most updated version, 22.0, at the time of the search. This discrepancy presents a challenge for users seeking the latest software, as it is not immediately apparent where to find the most current release.
A potential solution to this problem involves streamlining the download process and clarifying the representation of Bitcoin Core online. By removing direct download links from bitcoin.org and instead providing a link to bitcoincore.org, users could be directed more efficiently to the latest version of the software. This change would help eliminate confusion and ensure that individuals have access to the most up-to-date resources. Implementing such a redirection would require collaboration between the administrators of both sites, emphasizing the need for clear communication and shared goals within the Bitcoin community.
In summary, addressing the issue of outdated links and the presence of multiple sources for downloading Bitcoin Core is crucial for user convenience and the credibility of Bitcoin-related websites. Simplifying access to the latest versions by centralizing downloads through a single, updated source can enhance the overall user experience and support the ongoing development and adoption of Bitcoin technology.
